import pytest
from makeslides.domain.exceptions import (
    DomainException,
    PresentationValidationError,
    ThemeIncompatibilityError,
    VoiceNoteTooLongError,
    VoiceNoteTooShortError,
    TranscriptionFailedError
)

class TestDomainExceptions:
    """Test domain exception hierarchy"""

    def test_domain_exception_is_base_class(self):
        """All domain exceptions should inherit from DomainException"""
        assert issubclass(PresentationValidationError, DomainException)
        assert issubclass(ThemeIncompatibilityError, DomainException)
        assert issubclass(VoiceNoteTooLongError, DomainException)
        assert issubclass(VoiceNoteTooShortError, DomainException)
        assert issubclass(TranscriptionFailedError, DomainException)

    def test_presentation_validation_error(self):
        """PresentationValidationError should contain error message"""
        error = PresentationValidationError("Title cannot be empty")
        assert str(error) == "Title cannot be empty"
        assert isinstance(error, DomainException)

    def test_theme_incompatibility_error(self):
        """ThemeIncompatibilityError should contain incompatibility details"""
        error = ThemeIncompatibilityError("Dark theme incompatible with slide layouts")
        assert "Dark theme" in str(error)
        assert isinstance(error, DomainException)

    def test_voice_note_duration_errors(self):
        """Voice note duration errors should be specific"""
        too_long = VoiceNoteTooLongError("Duration 15 minutes exceeds limit")
        too_short = VoiceNoteTooShortError("Duration 3 seconds too short")

        assert "15 minutes" in str(too_long)
        assert "3 seconds" in str(too_short)
        assert isinstance(too_long, DomainException)
        assert isinstance(too_short, DomainException)
EOF

"""Domain-specific exceptions for business rule violations"""

class DomainException(Exception):
    """Base class for all domain-specific exceptions"""
    pass

class PresentationValidationError(DomainException):
    """Raised when presentation violates business rules"""
    pass

class ThemeIncompatibilityError(DomainException):
    """Raised when theme cannot be applied to presentation"""
    pass

class VoiceNoteTooLongError(DomainException):
    """Raised when voice note exceeds maximum duration"""
    pass

class VoiceNoteTooShortError(DomainException):
    """Raised when voice note is below minimum duration"""
    pass

class TranscriptionFailedError(DomainException):
    """Raised when voice transcription fails"""
    pass

class VoiceNoteAlreadyTranscribedError(DomainException):
    """Raised when attempting to transcribe already transcribed voice note"""
    pass

class LowConfidenceTranscriptionError(DomainException):
    """Raised when transcription confidence is too low"""
    pass

class VoiceNoteAlreadyLinkedError(DomainException):
    """Raised when voice note is already linked to a presentation"""
    pass

import pytest
from datetime import timedelta
from makeslides.domain.value_objects.duration import Duration

class TestDuration:
    """Test Duration value object"""

    def test_duration_from_seconds(self):
        """Duration should be created from seconds"""
        duration = Duration.from_seconds(300)  # 5 minutes
        assert duration.total_seconds() == 300
        assert duration.minutes == 5
        assert duration.seconds == 0

    def test_duration_from_minutes(self):
        """Duration should be created from minutes"""
        duration = Duration.from_minutes(2.5)  # 2.5 minutes
        assert duration.total_seconds() == 150
        assert duration.minutes == 2
        assert duration.seconds == 30

    def test_duration_validation(self):
        """Duration should validate negative values"""
        with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Duration cannot be negative"):
            Duration.from_seconds(-10)

    def test_duration_equality(self):
        """Duration objects should be comparable"""
        duration1 = Duration.from_seconds(120)
        duration2 = Duration.from_minutes(2)
        duration3 = Duration.from_seconds(150)

        assert duration1 == duration2
        assert duration1 != duration3

    def test_duration_string_representation(self):
        """Duration should have readable string representation"""
        duration = Duration.from_seconds(125)  # 2:05
        assert str(duration) == "2:05"

        duration_long = Duration.from_seconds(3665)  # 1:01:05
        assert str(duration_long) == "1:01:05"
EOF

    @classmethod
    def from_seconds(cls, seconds: Union[int, float]) -> 'Duration':
        """Create duration from seconds"""
        return cls(float(seconds))

    @classmethod
    def from_minutes(cls, minutes: Union[int, float]) -> 'Duration':
        """Create duration from minutes"""
        return cls(float(minutes * 60))

    def total_seconds(self) -> float:
        """Get total duration in seconds"""
        return self._total_seconds

    @property
    def minutes(self) -> int:
        """Get whole minutes part"""
        return int(self._total_seconds // 60)

    @property
    def seconds(self) -> int:
        """Get remaining seconds part"""
        return int(self._total_seconds % 60)

    @property
    def hours(self) -> int:
        """Get whole hours part"""
        return int(self._total_seconds // 3600)

    def __str__(self) -> str:
        """Human-readable string representation"""
        hours = self.hours
        minutes = self.minutes % 60
        seconds = self.seconds

        if hours > 0:
            return f"{hours}:{minutes:02d}:{seconds:02d}"
        else:
            return f"{minutes}:{seconds:02d}"

    def __eq__(self, other) -> bool:
        """Equality comparison"""
        if not isinstance(other, Duration):
            return False
        return abs(self._total_seconds - other._total_seconds) < 0.001  # Float precision
EOF
